info.name: PixCrawler Frontend Mock
info.description: Mock API collection for PixCrawler frontend development. This collection provides realistic mock responses for all backend endpoints, enabling frontend development without running the Python backend. Use with Prism mock server at http://localhost:4010/api/v1

variable.description: Base URL for the Prism mock server

item.name: Crawl Jobs
item.description: Endpoints for managing image crawl jobs, including creation, status tracking, and control operations (start, cancel, retry). Crawl jobs orchestrate the process of discovering and downloading images from multiple search engines.

request.description: Creates a new image crawl job with specified keywords and configuration. The job will be created in 'pending' status and must be started separately.
Retrieves detailed information about a specific crawl job including current status, progress, and chunk tracking metrics.
Starts execution of a pending crawl job by dispatching Celery tasks. Returns task IDs for tracking.
Cancels a running crawl job by revoking all active Celery tasks. Returns the number of tasks that were revoked.
Retries a failed crawl job by resetting its state and dispatching new Celery tasks. Only failed jobs can be retried.

response.name: Success - Job Retry Initiated

request.description: Retrieves detailed progress metrics for a crawl job including chunk status, image counts, and estimated completion time.

item.name: Validation
item.description: Endpoints for image validation operations, including single image analysis, batch validation, and validation statistics. Validation ensures image quality, detects duplicates, and verifies format compliance.

request.description: Analyzes a single image and returns validation results including format, dimensions, duplicate detection, and quality metrics.
Creates a batch validation job for multiple images. Returns a batch ID for tracking the validation progress.
Initiates validation for all images in a crawl job. Returns Celery task IDs for tracking the validation progress.

response.name: Success - Job Validation Started

request.description: Retrieves aggregated validation results for a crawl job including counts of valid, invalid, and duplicate images.
Retrieves comprehensive validation statistics for a dataset including coverage, quality score, and error breakdowns.
Updates the default validation level for future validation operations. Returns confirmation with the new level.

item.name: Credits & Billing
item.description: Endpoints for managing user credits, viewing transaction history, purchasing credits, and tracking usage metrics. The credit system enables pay-per-use billing for image processing operations.

request.description: Retrieves the current credit balance, monthly usage, and auto-refill settings for the authenticated user.

query.description: Filter by transaction type (purchase, usage, refund, bonus)

request.description: Retrieves a paginated list of credit transactions including purchases, usage, refunds, and bonuses.

response.name: Success - Transaction List

request.description: Purchases credits using the specified payment method. Returns transaction details and updated balance.

query.description: Start date for metrics (ISO 8601, defaults to 30 days ago)
End date for metrics (ISO 8601, defaults to today)

request.description: Retrieves usage metrics with daily breakdown for the specified date range. Includes credits used, images processed, storage, API calls, and bandwidth.

item.name: API Keys
item.description: Endpoints for managing API keys for programmatic access. API keys enable secure, rate-limited access to the PixCrawler API with configurable permissions and usage tracking.

request.description: Retrieves a list of all API keys for the authenticated user with usage statistics. The full key value is never returned, only the key prefix for identification.

response.name: Success - API Keys List
response.body:
{
  "data": [

request.description: Creates a new API key with specified permissions and rate limit. The full API key value is only returned once during creation and must be stored securely by the client.

response.name: Success - API Key Created

request.description: Revokes an API key, immediately preventing it from being used for authentication. This action cannot be undone.
Retrieves detailed usage statistics for a specific API key including total requests, success/failure rates, rate limit hits, and daily breakdown.

item.name: Storage
item.description: Endpoints for managing storage operations, including usage tracking, file listing, cleanup operations, and presigned URL generation for secure downloads. Storage is organized into hot, warm, and archive tiers.

request.description: Retrieves comprehensive storage usage information including total storage, limits, file counts, and breakdown by storage tier (hot, warm, archive).

query.description: Filter by storage tier (hot, warm, archive)

request.description: Retrieves a paginated list of files in storage with metadata including size, tier, and temporary download URLs.
Initiates cleanup of old files in storage. Deletes files older than the specified number of days and returns the count of deleted files and space freed.

response.name: Success - Storage Cleanup Completed

query.description: Path to the file in storage
Number of seconds until the URL expires (default 3600, max 86400)

request.description: Generates a temporary presigned URL for secure file download. The URL expires after the specified duration (default 1 hour).

item.name: Activity Logs
item.description: Endpoints for viewing user activity logs and audit trails. Activity logs track all user actions including resource creation, updates, deletions, and access patterns.

query.description: Filter by action type (create, update, delete, view, download, export)
Filter by resource type (project, crawl_job, image, dataset, api_key, credit_transaction)
Filter logs from this date (ISO 8601 format)
Filter logs until this date (ISO 8601 format)

request.description: Retrieves a paginated list of activity logs for the authenticated user. Activity logs track all user actions including resource creation, updates, deletions, and access.

response.name: Success - Activity Logs

item.name: Health Checks
item.description: Endpoints for checking system health and service status. Health checks provide information about database connectivity, Redis status, Celery workers, and overall system availability.

request.description: Returns basic system health status including overall status, timestamp, version, and uptime. This endpoint is suitable for load balancer health checks and basic monitoring.

Returns comprehensive system health status including service-level health for database, Redis, Celery workers, and storage. This endpoint provides detailed diagnostics for monitoring and troubleshooting.

response.name: Success - Detailed Health Status
